column4: evildennisr: how to edit the brub boot loader to change the default operating system?
at the top of the conf file change "default 0" to "default 1"
to boot the second entry by default
should i make it "true" from updatedefaultentry=false
then ubuntu won't reset the default entry the next time you upgrade
i want to make windows vista as default os
you should put "default 5" at the top of that file.. that should boot fista first
ok, if it's the wrong os that loads at default it just means that i can';t count and you need to put a different number as default :)
